memory_verse.label: Memory Verse
memory_verse.text: “But God has chosen the foolish things of the world to shame the wise; God has chosen the weak things of the world to shame the strong.” ( 1 Corinthians 1 : 27)

devotion.label: Insight / Reflection
devotion.text:
In schools, students who are weak or tall are often placed on the last bench. Many times, they are ignored and left unnoticed  that’s why they struggle to learn. Yet, many world changers once sat on those last benches. Hidden within them was a spark waiting to ignite.

But God’s perspective is different. Jesus chose Galilean fishermen ordinary and unlearned to shake the world. He trained, transformed, and used them to manifest His Kingdom. They were impulsive and imperfect, but their hearts carried divine fire. God breathed upon that fire and turned them into flames for His glory.

Even today, God chooses the weak vessels and fills them with His Spirit. Flesh and blood cannot inherit His Kingdom, but the humble and surrendered will.

Are you feeling unworthy or unskilled? Seek God. He is the One who creates everything out of nothing.

quote.label: Today's Quote
quote.text: “God takes ordinary people and does extraordinary things through them.”  Charles Spurgeon

prayer.label: Prayer
prayer.text: Lord, I offer my weaknesses to You. Use me as Your vessel of power and grace. Let Your Spirit fill me and make me fruitful for Your Kingdom. Amen.

conclusion.label: A Word to You
text: God will lift you from the last bench to the front line of His purpose.
Stay humble, stay aflame His glory will shine through you.
